message.content: {"id": "121323", "title": "Bug 121323: XML Edit Data Set dialog does not persist filter information", "description": "When leaving the dialog in XML Edit Data Set, RelationInformation gets persisted to .rptdesign, but the data stored in the filterInfo HashMap is lost. This is because the XPath expression for the column mapping with a selection part like 'section[@id='left']' is stripped off and stored in the filterInfo HashMap. However, treating XPath expressions in this way can lead to a lot of trouble.", "OB": "The filter information entered in the XML Edit Data Set dialog is not being persisted when leaving the dialog.", "EB": "The filter information entered in the XML Edit Data Set dialog should be persisted when leaving the dialog.", "SR": "Modify the XML Edit Data Set dialog to ensure that the filter information entered by the user is properly persisted when leaving the dialog."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '121323', 'title': 'Bug 121323XML Edit Data Set dialog does not persist filter information', 'description': '', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': "If one enters an XPath expression for the column mapping with a selectionpart like section[@id='left'] then within class RelationInformation theselection is stripped of and stored in filterInfo HashMap.When leaving the dialog, RelationInformation gets persited to .rptdesignbutdata stored in filterInfo is lost.HoweverIMHO treating XPath expressions in that way will lead to a lotof trouble. "}
